meanings.definition: A device or substance that modulates something, especially a radio wave or signal.
meanings.sent1: The modulator adjusted the radio signal for better reception.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed a new modulator to improve the radio transmission.
meanings.sent3: The modulator and the radio wave had a chat about signal strength.
meanings.sent4: Her voice acted as a modulator, changing the tone of the broadcast.
meanings.sent5: The modulator hummed softly as it fine-tuned the radio frequency.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that regulates or controls something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a modulator of classroom behavior.
meanings.sent2: The thermostat serves as a modulator for room temperature.
meanings.sent3: The modulator squirrel made sure all the nuts were in order.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor acted as a modulator in the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The traffic light acted as a modulator, controlling the flow of cars.

meanings.definition: A protein or other molecule that regulates gene expression.
meanings.sent1: The modulator protein played a crucial role in gene regulation.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the modulator molecule to understand genetic control.
meanings.sent3: The modulator molecule threw a party for the genes it regulated.
meanings.sent4: The modulator protein was the conductor of the genetic orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The modulator molecule danced around the DNA, turning genes on and off.
